    • Migration from React

Migration from React

Step-by-step guide to migrating your React applications to PhilJS with comparison examples and migration strategies.

Why Migrate to PhilJS?

  • Performance: Fine-grained reactivity means no virtual DOM diffing
  • Bundle Size: Smaller bundles without runtime overhead
  • Developer Experience: Simpler mental model, less boilerplate
  • Type Safety: Better TypeScript integration with signal types
  • Flexibility: Choose between CSR, SSR, or Islands architecture

Key Differences

State Management

React

1function Counter() {
2  const [count, setCount] = useState(0);
3 
4  return (
5    <button onClick={() => setCount(count + 1)}>
6      Count: {count}
7    </button>
8  );
9}

PhilJS

1function Counter() {
2  const [count, setCount] = createSignal(0);
3 
4  return (
5    <button onClick={() => setCount(c => c + 1)}>
6      Count: {count()}
7    </button>
8  );
9}

Effects

React

1useEffect(() => {
2  console.log('Count:', count);
3}, [count]);
4 
5useEffect(() => {
6  // Runs once on mount
7  fetchData();
8}, []);

PhilJS

1createEffect(() => {
2  console.log('Count:', count());
3});
4 
5onMount(() => {
6  // Runs once on mount
7  fetchData();
8});
i

Auto-tracking

PhilJS effects automatically track dependencies. No dependency array needed!

Computed Values

React

1const doubled = useMemo(
2  () => count * 2,
3  [count]
4);

PhilJS

1const doubled = createMemo(
2  () => count() * 2
3);

Conditional Rendering

React

1{isLoggedIn ? (
2  <Dashboard />
3) : (
4  <LoginForm />
5)}
6 
7{messages.length > 0 && (
8  <MessageList messages={messages} />
9)}

PhilJS

1<Show
2  when={isLoggedIn()}
3  fallback={<LoginForm />}
4>
5  <Dashboard />
6</Show>
7 
8<Show when={messages().length > 0}>
9  <MessageList messages={messages()} />
10</Show>

Lists

React

1{items.map(item => (
2  <Item
3    key={item.id}
4    item={item}
5  />
6))}

PhilJS

1<For each={items()}>
2  {(item) => (
3    <Item item={item} />
4  )}
5</For>

Migration Strategy

1. Incremental Migration

You can gradually migrate your React app by running PhilJS alongside React:

1// Install PhilJS
2npm install philjs-core philjs-router
3 
4// In your existing React app
5import { render } from 'philjs-core';
6import { PhilJSComponent } from './PhilJSComponent';
7 
8function App() {
9  return (
10    <div>
11      {/* Existing React code */}
12      <ReactComponent />
13 
14      {/* New PhilJS component */}
15      <div ref={el => {
16        if (el) render(PhilJSComponent, el);
17      }} />
18    </div>
19  );
20}

2. Component-by-Component

Start with leaf components (no children) and work your way up:

  1. Identify components with no dependencies on React-specific features
  2. Convert simple presentational components first
  3. Move to components with state and effects
  4. Convert context providers and consumers
  5. Finally, convert routing and layout components

Hooks Migration Guide

React HookPhilJS EquivalentNotes
useStatecreateSignalSignals return getters/setters
useEffectcreateEffectAuto-tracks dependencies
useMemocreateMemoAuto-tracks dependencies
useCallbackNot neededFunctions are stable by default
useReflet variableRegular variables work fine
useContextuseContextSimilar API, use with provide_context
useReducercreateStoreMore powerful with nested reactivity

Common Patterns

Custom Hooks

React

1function useCounter(initial = 0) {
2  const [count, setCount] = useState(initial);
3 
4  const increment = useCallback(() => {
5    setCount(c => c + 1);
6  }, []);
7 
8  return { count, increment };
9}
10 
11// Usage
12const { count, increment } = useCounter();

PhilJS

1function createCounter(initial = 0) {
2  const [count, setCount] = createSignal(initial);
3 
4  const increment = () => {
5    setCount(c => c + 1);
6  };
7 
8  return { count, increment };
9}
10 
11// Usage
12const { count, increment } = createCounter();

Context

React

1const ThemeContext = createContext();
2 
3function App() {
4  const [theme, setTheme] = useState('light');
5 
6  return (
7    <ThemeContext.Provider value={{ theme, setTheme }}>
8      <Child />
9    </ThemeContext.Provider>
10  );
11}
12 
13function Child() {
14  const { theme } = useContext(ThemeContext);
15  return <div>{theme}</div>;
16}

PhilJS

1const ThemeContext = createContext();
2 
3function App() {
4  const [theme, setTheme] = createSignal('light');
5 
6  provide_context(ThemeContext, { theme, setTheme });
7 
8  return <Child />;
9}
10 
11function Child() {
12  const { theme } = useContext(ThemeContext);
13  return <div>{theme()}</div>;
14}

Data Fetching

React

1function UserProfile({ userId }) {
2  const [user, setUser] = useState(null);
3  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
4  const [error, setError] = useState(null);
5 
6  useEffect(() => {
7    setLoading(true);
8    fetch(`/api/users/${userId}`)
9      .then(res => res.json())
10      .then(setUser)
11      .catch(setError)
12      .finally(() => setLoading(false));
13  }, [userId]);
14 
15  if (loading) return <Spinner />;
16  if (error) return <Error error={error} />;
17  return <div>{user.name}</div>;
18}

PhilJS

1function UserProfile(props) {
2  const [user] = createResource(
3    () => props.userId,
4    (id) => fetch(`/api/users/${id}`)
5      .then(res => res.json())
6  );
7 
8  return (
9    <Show
10      when={!user.loading}
11      fallback={<Spinner />}
12    >
13      <Show
14        when={!user.error}
15        fallback={<Error error={user.error} />}
16      >
17        <div>{user()?.name}</div>
18      </Show>
19    </Show>
20  );
21}

Tooling Migration

Package.json Updates

package.jsonjson
1{
2  "dependencies": {
3    // Remove React
4    // "react": "^18.2.0",
5    // "react-dom": "^18.2.0",
6 
7    // Add PhilJS
8    "philjs-core": "^1.0.0",
9    "philjs-router": "^1.0.0"
10  },
11  "devDependencies": {
12    // Update JSX config
13    "vite": "^5.0.0",
14    "philjs-compiler": "^1.0.0"
15  }
16}

Vite Configuration

vite.config.tstypescript
1import { defineConfig } from 'vite';
2import philjs from 'philjs-compiler/vite';
3 
4export default defineConfig({
5  plugins: [philjs()],
6  esbuild: {
7    jsx: 'automatic',
8    jsxImportSource: 'philjs-core',
9  },
10});

TypeScript Configuration

tsconfig.jsonjson
1{
2  "compilerOptions": {
3    "jsx": "react-jsx",
4    "jsxImportSource": "philjs-core",
5    // ... other options
6  }
7}

Common Migration Issues

Issue: Reading Signal Values

!

Common Mistake

Remember to call signals as functions to read their values!
1const [count, setCount] = createSignal(0);
2 
3// Wrong
4console.log(count); // Logs the signal function
5 
6// Correct
7console.log(count()); // Logs the value

Issue: Dependency Tracking

1const [count, setCount] = createSignal(0);
2 
3// Wrong - reads outside effect, won't track
4const value = count();
5createEffect(() => {
6  console.log(value); // Won't re-run when count changes
7});
8 
9// Correct - reads inside effect
10createEffect(() => {
11  console.log(count()); // Re-runs when count changes
12});

Issue: Conditional Signal Reads

1// Avoid conditional signal reads in effects
2createEffect(() => {
3  if (someCondition) {
4    console.log(count()); // May break reactivity
5  }
6});
7 
8// Better: Use Show or createMemo
9createEffect(() => {
10  const value = count(); // Always read signals
11  if (someCondition) {
12    console.log(value);
13  }
14});

Complete Example: Todo App

Here's a complete before/after of a todo app migration:

Click to see full React version
1import { useState, useCallback } from 'react';
2 
3interface Todo {
4  id: string;
5  text: string;
6  completed: boolean;
7}
8 
9function TodoApp() {
10  const [todos, setTodos] = useState<Todo[]>([]);
11  const [input, setInput] = useState('');
12  const [filter, setFilter] = useState<'all' | 'active' | 'completed'>('all');
13 
14  const filteredTodos = useMemo(() => {
15    switch (filter) {
16      case 'active':
17        return todos.filter(t => !t.completed);
18      case 'completed':
19        return todos.filter(t => t.completed);
20      default:
21        return todos;
22    }
23  }, [todos, filter]);
24 
25  const addTodo = useCallback((e: React.FormEvent) => {
26    e.preventDefault();
27    if (!input.trim()) return;
28 
29    setTodos(prev => [...prev, {
30      id: crypto.randomUUID(),
31      text: input,
32      completed: false,
33    }]);
34    setInput('');
35  }, [input]);
36 
37  const toggleTodo = useCallback((id: string) => {
38    setTodos(prev => prev.map(todo =>
39      todo.id === id
40        ? { ...todo, completed: !todo.completed }
41        : todo
42    ));
43  }, []);
44 
45  return (
46    <div>
47      <form onSubmit={addTodo}>
48        <input
49          value={input}
50          onChange={e => setInput(e.target.value)}
51        />
52        <button type="submit">Add</button>
53      </form>
54 
55      <div>
56        <button onClick={() => setFilter('all')}>All</button>
57        <button onClick={() => setFilter('active')}>Active</button>
58        <button onClick={() => setFilter('completed')}>Completed</button>
59      </div>
60 
61      <ul>
62        {filteredTodos.map(todo => (
63          <li key={todo.id}>
64            <input
65              type="checkbox"
66              checked={todo.completed}
67              onChange={() => toggleTodo(todo.id)}
68            />
69            <span>{todo.text}</span>
70          </li>
71        ))}
72      </ul>
73    </div>
74  );
75}
Click to see PhilJS version
1import { createSignal, createMemo, For } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3interface Todo {
4  id: string;
5  text: string;
6  completed: boolean;
7}
8 
9function TodoApp() {
10  const [todos, setTodos] = createSignal<Todo[]>([]);
11  const [input, setInput] = createSignal('');
12  const [filter, setFilter] = createSignal<'all' | 'active' | 'completed'>('all');
13 
14  const filteredTodos = createMemo(() => {
15    switch (filter()) {
16      case 'active':
17        return todos().filter(t => !t.completed);
18      case 'completed':
19        return todos().filter(t => t.completed);
20      default:
21        return todos();
22    }
23  });
24 
25  const addTodo = (e: Event) => {
26    e.preventDefault();
27    const text = input().trim();
28    if (!text) return;
29 
30    setTodos(prev => [...prev, {
31      id: crypto.randomUUID(),
32      text,
33      completed: false,
34    }]);
35    setInput('');
36  };
37 
38  const toggleTodo = (id: string) => {
39    setTodos(prev => prev.map(todo =>
40      todo.id === id
41        ? { ...todo, completed: !todo.completed }
42        : todo
43    ));
44  };
45 
46  return (
47    <div>
48      <form onSubmit={addTodo}>
49        <input
50          value={input()}
51          onInput={e => setInput(e.currentTarget.value)}
52        />
53        <button type="submit">Add</button>
54      </form>
55 
56      <div>
57        <button onClick={() => setFilter('all')}>All</button>
58        <button onClick={() => setFilter('active')}>Active</button>
59        <button onClick={() => setFilter('completed')}>Completed</button>
60      </div>
61 
62      <ul>
63        <For each={filteredTodos()}>
64          {(todo) => (
65            <li>
66              <input
67                type="checkbox"
68                checked={todo.completed}
69                onChange={() => toggleTodo(todo.id)}
70              />
71              <span>{todo.text}</span>
72            </li>
73          )}
74        </For>
75      </ul>
76    </div>
77  );
78}
